column4: hey guys, having a major problem with installing ubuntu. It detects my hard drive, but it doesnt detect the current partition table. I got 2 partitions in use, one for windows other is for data. Dont want to lose my data, too much to lose.
ubuntu's livecd wont detect my partition table but it does detect the drive showing everything unallocated, but windows does no problem. any ideas?
no; no idea not even gparted ? System>Admin>Partition Editor ?? or the output of "sudo fdisk -lÂ·
i've never herd of such a thing so i'm afraid i can not help much ...
